title: Json version without spaces with 1408 tokens
body:
I produced this version from the original json file with a simple Python script
You might want to add this as an alternative to markdown

title: specify curriculum/ topics for each depth level
body: Can you add the ability to configure a particular curriculum or math topics/s for each depth level?

title: I click this link，and OpenAI give me 404
body: ![image](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/14066163/77bc3ada-a4f4-42ea-aad6-3814238da295)

title: I
Change Depth Configuration
body:
## Problem
The tool gives superficial lessons on topics despite using the higher levels on the Depth parameter.

It would be nice to get something more in depth/longer lessons on topics without having to upgrade the complexity in how it is explained. For example, learning about X topic at a masters level using this tool is quite superficial, however, upgrading it to PhD makes it more complex to understand but still does not cover the full breadth of the topic. 

## Proposed Solution
I think this could be overcome by renaming the current "Depth" configuration to "Level".

Then by adding a new "Depth" configuration to instead have options such as:

1. Foundational
2. Intermediate
3. Comprehensive

By using these terms, it may allow for more flexibility in learning depth without necessarily increasing the complexity of the content.

title: Update README.md, URL error
body: URL error

title: deviating from original lesson plan after a few lessons
body:
After doing some basic tests, while still very informative and educational, I find that it doesn't stick with its original lesson plan. For example, I had a 10 part lesson plan created in the beginning. It stuck with the first 3 as outlined, but on lesson 4 it started on similar-but-different topics than originally outlined in the plan and said the lesson plan was complete after lesson 6.

It has done with 3 times now in my tests - all tests have started with a fresh chat, going through config, and only using a /plan prompt, followed by /continue commands until it says its done.

Maybe there is a way to remind the tutor of the original lesson plan within its self-reminder somehow?

![Screenshot 2023-06-01 at 10 33 49 AM](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/20192877/85c81b08-223c-4561-89e9-5b91ba65ff34)

title: How to use
body:
I am new and I would like to ask how to use these files?
Put them after the “system” field？
thanks.

title: AI will forget the plan If I ask some detail info of some step and then return
body:
Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. set a plan and start to learn
2. in section n, for example section 3, ask some questions about this section and make a chat with it more than 5 Q-A rounds.
3. type /continue
4. the AI forget the plan, and will ask you to set the plan again.

I am sure the total token is less than 8k. and I use GPT-4-32K

title: Iterative Planning and Lesson & Ladder Plan Hype!
body: I'm super looking forward to the Iterative Planning and Lesson and Ladder Plan features! The potential for them to give us high-quality complete tutorials for absolutely any topic is unbelievably exciting.

title: Suggestion: Use the new "Shared Link" feature to make getting started even easier
body:
OpenAI has added a a new [share link](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/7925741-chatgpt-shared-links-faq) feature to ChatGPT that lets you share a conversion and, importantly, let others continue the conversion in their own private session. With this, you can cut out the copy+paste step of getting started with Mr Ranedeer!

For example: https://chat.openai.com/share/5c2850c0-1ce9-456b-9ca0-44faf40ec2bf

After heading there just click "Continue this conversation" to pick up the conversation and configure the tutor in your own private session. This could be used to help others get started near-instantly without having to find a file on GitHub and copy and paste the large blob of text.

title: Share me what you're learning with Mr. Ranedeer!
body: I would like to compile a list of images of what people have been learning with Mr. Ranedeer, whether it be chess, mathematics, English, coding, etc. This will be in a separate markdown file for everyone to see!

title: ai学习助手
Improve question accuracy by only giving one question at a time
body:
I've noticed that GPT-4 is better at telling whether the user's response is correct or not if it gives one question at a time. When I was making my own prompt for a tutor, I found that making it give only 1 question at a time (though sub-questions are fine) greatly improves it's accuracy in saying whether user's answer is correct or not. 

In Mr. Ranedeer, I noticed that it gives questions 2 at a time and so in this case when my first answer is right and second is wrong, it tells me the second answer is correct and first is wrong!
![image](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/25204941/3f8e22ea-b027-491e-ae64-abbb2eeb66fb)

I suggest adding the 'only 1 question at a time, multiple sub-questions are allowed' option somewhere in the prompt. This is purely from my personal experience with GPT-4 though.

title: [Tokens 1,278] Introduce a new PDL (Protocol Description Language) format that allows for maximum token optimization
body:
PDL (Prompt Description Language) format provides an extensible way to describe the behavior and characteristics of prompts. Inspired by json/yaml/toml/markdown designs, PDL aims to minimize the token count compared to json/yaml/toml/markdown.

[https://github.com/ZhangHanDong/prompt-description-language/tree/main](https://github.com/ZhangHanDong/prompt-description-language/tree/main).

- Tokens 1,278
- Characters 4,158

title: add Mr_Ranedeer.toml (Tokens: 1,713)
body:
Tokens: 1,713
Characters: 5757

title: Changing language doesn't work on the MD format
body:
From https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/discussions/35 and https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/discussions/28

# Reproduction
1. Copy and paste [the MD format](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/blob/main/Mr_Ranedeer.md)
2. Say `/language Chinese`

# Result
![image](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/36951064/5d079d3c-023d-440d-b88f-78f4749ea58b)

# Workarounds
1. You can alternatively sacrifice token count by instead using the [JSON](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/blob/main/Mr_Ranedeer.json) and [YAML](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/blob/main/Mr_Ranedeer.yaml)
2. You can say `Change your language to chinese please :)`

title: Credits for you JushBJJ
body:
I created an OKR Assistant called Mia Kürten, in the readme I added a section for giving credits to you @JushBJJ 

https://github.com/angelkurten/Mia-Kurten-AI-OKR-Assistant

Context: I'm an Engineering Manager and I have 25 devs on my team, this assistant is helpful in my work

title: What is the problem?
body:
![image](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/16834473/682b89dd-4f74-4c44-80b6-58f5017b6990)

After entering the prompt, the set language is different from expected.

title: Add an interactive mode to choose preferences

milestone.title: GPT-4-32k
milestone.description: Features to be added for a rollout release of GPT-4 32k model to ChatGPT Plus

body:
## Context 
I am not super familiar with what reasoning framework I would prefer along with some of the other settings. I did [read the docs](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/blob/main/docs.md) but I still don't really know which one to choose.

## Current Behavior/Workaround
I asked Chat to ask me questions to narrow down what setting to choose
![image](https://github.com/JushBJJ/Mr.-Ranedeer-AI-Tutor/assets/9572232/4009f81b-8ed5-4655-ad69-865f2bd09ec8)

## Ideal behavior
There should be a 'wizard' workflow that helps the user decide what settings to use.
